panels.description: Uncorrectable media errors are failures to read or write to the physical disk that could not be resolved using error correction technology. These errors can lead to reallocating sectors. Large or rapidly increasing numbers of media errors may be an indicator that a drive will fail, especially on HDDs.
panels.title: Uncorrectable Media Errors

panels.description: Transport errors are failures to send or receive data between the drive controller and the disk. Large or rapidly increasing numbers of transport errors may be an indicator that the disk needs to be reseated, the transport cable needs to be replaced, the disk may needs to be replaced, or the drive controller needs to be replaced.
panels.title: Transport Errors
